summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan scheduling Ghislaine Maxwell's sentencing for June 28, 2022, at 11:00 a.m. It also addresses the schedule for post-verdict motions and deferred proceedings related to severed perjury counts, requiring a joint letter from the parties regarding Speedy Trial Act exclusions.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant whose sentencing is being scheduled in the case USA v. Maxwell.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge who signed the order scheduling Maxwell's sentencing and managing the case proceedings.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell, as evidenced by her signing the sentencing order.

events.title: Maxwell Sentencing Scheduled
events.description: The court schedules the sentencing for Ghislaine Maxwell for June 28, 2022, at 11:00 a.m.

events.title: Court Order Issued
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan signs the order scheduling Maxwell's sentencing and setting deadlines for joint letters regarding post-verdict motions and perjury counts.

events.title: Deadline for Government Joint Letter
events.description: The Government must indicate in a joint letter whether it seeks an exclusion of time under the Speedy Trial Act for the perjury counts.

events.title: Presentence Report Delay
events.description: The court will delay ordering the preparation of a presentence investigation report until April 2022.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's sentencing was officially scheduled for June 28, 2022, at 11:00 a.m. before Judge Alison J. Nathan.
The court deferred scheduling proceedings related to severed perjury counts until after post-verdict motions were resolved.
The government was required to indicate by January 18, 2022, whether it sought a Speedy Trial Act exclusion for the perjury counts.
The preparation of a presentence investigation report was delayed until April 2022.
